before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ccd51","text":"You will need access to the following free and open-source software program(s):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"921r3","text":"minimap2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":8}],"data":[]},{"key":"3lfl2","text":"samtools","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":8}],"data":[]},{"key":"a0vkt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qjvn","text":"And the following additional data file(s):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eu5i1","text":"a FASTA file containing the genome / sequence of interest.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7A236DEC469243DD91BE6819DABD7798","url":"https://github.com/lh3/minimap2#install"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"068394FAB0BA4A47B41E27F9B391D23F","url":"http://www.htslib.org/download/"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhvce","text":"This protocol demonstrates how to map strand-oriented long reads to a genome, and visualise them in a genome browser.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9jcf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fu3m","text":"The general idea is to use minimap2 to create stranded BAM files, which are split for forward/reverse orientation then converted into BigWig format for display in a genome browser.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a795b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqpbd","text":"Input(s): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbtho","text":"stranded fastq files (see protocol Preparing Reads for Stranded Mapping)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":36}],"data":{}},{"key":"8dnu1","text":"a FASTA file containing the genome / sequence of interest.\n ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ojic","text":"Output(s):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avnru","text":"Genome-mapped stranded BAM files","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjr0k","text":"Genome-mapped stranded BigWig files","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CD9E2910661D11E9BF52E752A6ECEFB5","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparing-reads-for-stranded-mapping-5qpvon2zzl4o"}}}}

groups.title: High molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

{"blocks":[{"key":"bo85s","text":"Map the long reads to the genome using minimap2, using samtools to covert to a sorted BAM format. This is where the reverse complementing done during demultiplexing gives a big saving of effort. As this BAM file is one of the main outputs, the run name is added to the file name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3m3f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bdpr","text":" steps.section: Creating BigWig Coverage Files (not needed for JBrowse 2)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"brg3p","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2pk7g","text":"A bedGraph of coverage is created using BEDTools. The default options for BEDTools treat sequence deletions (which happen frequently in nanopore reads) as a drop in coverage, which can make exon hunting and coverage calculation more difficult. I submitted a pull request to add an additional ignoreD parameter to the command line to allow cDNA reads with split coverage across introns to ignore deletions when considering coverage; this request has now been incorporated into the main BEDtools repository (as of v2.30.0):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":292,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":256,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"6iqde","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"63i7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgj71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qgvu","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"3rk17","text":"If this has worked properly, then mapping human or mouse to the mitochondrial genome with a LinearSNPCoverageDisplay in log scale should show a stepped expression, a bit like the Expected Results shown here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cjtf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9c7ef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"n1fh","text":"   ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fhi4k","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"D6C59AC0A67D11EC9149F1024FBF255C","height":169,"id":218353,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":"step-7D98DDDAED2E4E85A26F8EBC20B28164-nested-draft-5cjtf","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-03-18 at 18.35.38.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxhvjpt6.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxhtjpt6.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxhujpt6.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gxhsjpt6.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}
